CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. PCDTBT
4. DSeBT
5. 2,7-carbazole
6. diselenienylbenzothiadiazole

These are the names of the materials being discussed in the paragraph, and they are all considered "Material Name" entities.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. PCDTBT
4. DSeBT

These four entities are the names of materials that are being discussed in the paragraph, and they are all relevant to the context of Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDSeBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCDTBT |
| DSeBT |

These are the four material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in the same words as in the original text.

This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDSeBT : PC71BM
 * PCDSeBT: Poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole)
 * PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl)
2. PCDTBT
 * PCDTBT: Poly(3-cyanophenylene vinylene)
3. Thiophene
4. Selenophene
5. Diselenienylbenzothiadiazole (DSeBT)
6. 2,7-carbazole
7. 3-hexylthiophene

Note: The names of the materials are based on the IUPAC rules and the way they are presented in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Names of Materials:

1. PCDSeBT
2. PC71BM
3. Thiophene
4. Selenophene
5. Diselenienylbenzothiadiazole (DSeBT)

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to Property Names of Materials:

1. 2,7-carbazole
2. 3-hexylthiophene

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: However , the rms roughness is somewhat reduced to from 0.47 to 0.43 nm with thermal treatment , being favorable for charge separation and transport. This can reasonably explain the enhanced efficiency via the postannealing effect. Note that , in stark contrast to PCDTBT : PC71BM system in which thermal annealing reduced the photovoltaic parameters ( FF , J SC , and V OC ) , 22 the performance of all PCDSeBT - based devices for this study is considerably improved as a result of thermal treatment. We can conclude that the formation of crystalline nanoscale domains would be slightly induced in PCDSeBT : PC71BM with a thermal treatment in consequence of the ordered crystalline nature of the PCDSeBT on annealing as supported by the XRD results above as well as the large quinoidal character in the polymer backbone as the inclusion of selenophene. 23 The AFM of the annealed film gives an evidence for slightly nanofibril - like organization ( see Figure 5b ). The hole and electron mobilities of PCDSeBT : PC71BM ( 1 : 4 w / w ) blends were measured using the space - charge - limited current ( SCLC ) method and the J-V characteristics were plotted in Figure 6. The hole mobility ( μ hole = 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2 / V°s ) obtained with the thermally annealed film is one order higher than that without post annealing ( μ hole = 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2 / V°s ) , whereas in the both cases , the electron mobilities ( μ electron ) are similar ( 1.24 × 10^-3 and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2 / V°s ) for as-cast and annealed films , respectively , yielding a smaller difference between the mobility ratio for the annealed film. The higher mobilities and more balanced charge transport should definitely favor the charge transportation in the blend film and lead to high solar cell performance , supporting the b e n e fi c i a l e ff e c t o f t h e t h e r m a l a n n e a l i n g o n PCDSeBT : PC71BM cells . In conclusion , diselenienylbenzothiadiazole ( DSeBT ) units have successfully been incorporated into a D-A polymer backbone by Suzuki polymerization with 2,7-carbazole comonomer , affording a poly(2,7-carbazole-alt-diselenienylbenzothiadiazole) ( PCDSeBT ) ; This design motif is that replacement of thiophenes to selenophene units in PCDTBT that acts as a superior p - type photoactive material for PSCs , induces a lower bandgap ( 1.70 eV ) than that of PCDTBT ( 1.85 eV ) , while the ideal HOMO energy level ( -5.40 eV ) is still maintained.

Let's think step by step.

1. The first value mentioned in the paragraph is 0.47 nm, which is the rms roughness of the material.
2. The next value mentioned is 0.43 nm, which is the reduced rms roughness after thermal treatment.
3. The following values are 1:4 w/w, which represents the weight ratio of PCDSeBT to PC71BM in the blend film.
4. The hole mobility values are 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2/V°s and 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2/V°s, which are the mobilities of the thermally annealed and as-cast films, respectively.
5. The electron mobility values are 1.24 × 10^-3 cm^2/V°s and 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2/V°s, which are the mobilities of the thermally annealed and as-cast films, respectively.
6. The bandgap values of PCDSeBT and PCDTBT are 1.70 eV and 1.85 eV, respectively.
7. The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT is -5.40 eV.

Therefore, the values (number + unit) of material properties in the paragraph are:

* 0.47 nm (rms roughness)
* 0.43 nm (reduced rms roughness)
* 1:4 w/w (weight ratio of PCDSeBT to PC71BM)
* 4.68 × 10^-5 cm^2/V°s (hole mobility of thermally annealed film)
* 4.02 × 10^-6 cm^2/V°s (hole mobility of as-cast film)
* 1.24 × 10^-3 cm^2/V°s (electron mobility of thermally annealed film)
* 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2/V°s (electron mobility of as-cast film)
* 1.70 eV (bandgap of PCDSeBT)
* 1.85 eV (bandgap of PCDTBT)
* -5.40 eV (HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties:

* 0.47 nm (rms roughness)
* 0.43 nm (reduced rms roughness)
* 1.70 eV (bandgap of PCDSeBT)
* 1.85 eV (bandgap of PCDTBT)
* -5.40 eV (HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT)

* 5.58 × 10^-3 cm^2/V°s (electron mobility of as-cast film)
